page.title: 04BARFORD CHURCH AND CROSS
page.content: The church was built at the same time as Salisbury Cathedral. It is made of flint and stone, with a part old tile,part slate roof. It is cruciform with an Early English chancel. The nave, central tower, south transept and font are Perpendicular. The north transept is later. The pulpit is C17. The altar is formed from an old Spanish chest and is elaborately carved. The village cross is in the centre of the road, outside the church. It is an old preaching cross, possibly earlier than Norman times. It is a stone shaft with a cross on top and with a square base.
